Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that "All 'Obama phones' will be cut off after 31 December 2016," when in fact there is no evidence or basis for this statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Lifeline program, often referred to as "Obama phones," will be discontinued or cut off based on the outcome of the 2016 presidential election, which is a problematic assumption as there is no factual basis for this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to substantiate the assertion that "Obama phones" will be cut off after a specific date.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Lifeline program, which includes subsidized telephone service for low-income residents, is not specific to President Obama and is not slated for any major changes or discontinuation based on the 2016 presidential election outcome.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists, which is that the mention of "cutting off Obama phones" is mostly humorous in nature and not based on any actual developments or plans to discontinue the Lifeline program.
